review_title: A fantastic place to make a difference
job_title: Director of Communications and Marketing in London, England
pros:
- Working at the leading edge of sustainability consultancy with multi national businesses and FTSE100 companies, finding solutions to create a sustainable society and economy
- Talented, intelligent, and committed colleagues and a progressive culture that supports wellbeing and career development
- A charity and social enterprise, where all profits are reinvested into public education to influence government policy and industry best practice
cons: - In common with others in the sustainability sector we're not yet as diverse as we would like, but are working hard to put this right.

review_title: One of the best places I've worked so far
pros: I feel lucky to work in a fun, supportive environment surrounded by knowledgeable, lovely team members who are all passionate about sustainability. The work is varied and meaningful and I have a lot of opportunities for development here. The work-life balance is also pretty good!
cons: Could be more diverse but I guess it's a reflection of the sustainability sector as a whole. The organisation is aware of this though and is actively looking at ways to address this and improve, which is fantastic.

review_title: Friendly and climate driven sustainability charity wanting to make a difference
pros:
Everyone at Bioregional is very approachable - all the way up to the CEO - as well as being truly passionate about people and the planet. 

There's lots of scope to work on a number of different projects due to the charity working across a number of industries. It's a great place to learn new skills too, due to the varied technical project work delivered to clients.

The charity's overall mission is very clear: to bring as many people, businesses, cities etc as possible to adopt a one planet living mentality.
cons: Salaries could be better (it is a small charity though)
